subject: HowStuffWorks Automotive Newsletter April 24, 2007
body:
howstuffworks® | automotive April 24, 2007
RSS
   How the Caparo T1 Works
  The Caparo T1 is a two-seat, open-wheel supercar with a higher horsepower-to-weight ratio than any previously available production model. Find out how the 
Caparo T1 compares to race cars, how it travels so fast and why, even though it's as fast as a race car, it's still street legal. 
Also at HowStuffWorks

How Selling a Car Works - Are you ready to bid goodbye to your old car? If
you follow some simple guidelines, finding a buyer and closing the deal can
actually be pretty easy. Find out how to sell your car successfully.
 

How E85 Ethanol Flex Fuel Works - E85 ethanol flex fuel is made up of 85 percent ethanol and
15 percent conventional gasoline. Learn how that translates into lower air
pollution and what it means for your pocketbook.
 

How Superchargers Work - A great way to give a normal-sized engine more power is to
force more air into the combustion chamber by means of a supercharger. Learn
about superchargers and how they add horsepower to an engine.
   
This Week's Video 

Review of 2008 Chrysler Group Minivans - While other automakers are moving away from the minivan in
favor of crossover-type vehicles, the Chrysler Group has chosen to stick with
its winning formula and add newly standard features to its popular "family
rooms on wheels." Take a look at the redesigned Dodge and Chrysler
minivans introduced at the 2007 Detroit Auto Show.
